heisig_chinese_memo: If I eat BEANS, after ONE MOUTHful I fart like some kind of HORNED ANIMAL.

origin_of_ch_char_book: (ÈÑï, ‰π°, xiang=hsiang, countryside) describes the vessel with high leg (Ë±Ü, dou, beans) which is filled with an offering and two people who are watching over the vessel. They are smelling the precious offering and celebrating a ceremony.,(Ë±ä, ‰∏∞, feng, abundant) is composed of a ceremonial bowl (Ë±Ü, dou, bean) and many pods of beans or ears of grain .
humanum_full_description_en:
In ancient times , " bean " originally referred to a vessel for pickled vegetables, meat sauce and other foods. The original meaning was a high-ring-footed food vessel, and it was later borrowed as the " bean " of soybean and wheat. "Said Wen": "Beans, ancient meat-eating tools. From the mouth, pictograms. All beans belong to the beans. £Ö£, the ancient words beans." Press " bean " to top a horizontal elephant cover, the middle is like a bean body, and the lower is like a pillar Foot and base. " Beans " appeared in the Shang Dynasty and prevailed in the Spring and Autumn Period and Warring States Period. They are made of pottery, but also made of wood and bronze. Later generations may use " beans " as ritual vessels, "Er Ya. "Shiqi": "Dalok beans are called beans, bamboo beans are called Á¨æ, and tile beans are called Deng." Guo Pu's note: "Beans are also ritual vessels." " Beans " contain pickles and meat sauce , "Zhou Li. Heaven official tomb.ÈÜ¢‰∫∫": "The beans of the dynasty, in fact, leeks, ÈÜìÈÜ¢, Changben, mikyu, jingchu, deer, ÈÜ¢Ëèπ, and mikyu" refer to the beans presented during the rituals of the dynasty. The food is pickles made with leeks, juicy meat sauce, etc.

Jiajin inscriptions are used as place names and pronounced "ÈÉñ". "Collection" 24713: "Cai (in) beans." Discrete: "Bean people Yu." Zai Fuyan: "Wang Lai Beast (hunting) from Dou Yi (Lu)" means that the king came to hunt from the foot of Jidi Mountain. "Shuowen": "Xi, Hongnong County Yudi. Congyi, the sound of beans." Another inscription is used as the original meaning, referring to a high-circle-footed food vessel, Zhou Shengdou: "Zhou Shengzha (made) Zundou."

Qi Tao is used as a measure word and is an ancient unit of weight, such as "Ancient Pottery Prose Compilation" 3.46: "Haodo." "Zuo Zhuan. "Three Years of Zhao": "Four ascended to beans."

In the handed down literature, " bean " is also used as the " bean " of soybean and wheat. "Guang Ya": "Soybeans, Tang Ye; Xiaodou, Ning Ye." "Zhan Guo Ce. "Han Ceyi": "Korean land is dangerous, mountain dwellings, and grains, not wheat but beans", which means that the Korean geography during the Warring States period was bad, the people lived in the mountains, and the grain produced was either wheat or beans (Wang Yinzhi" Jing Chuan Ci": "And, you are also."). Later, the word " dou " was differentiated for the pseudonymous meaning of " dou " in soy wheat. However, " dou " is still commonly used to mean the " dou " of soybean and wheat after the word " dou " appeared.
humanum_short_description_en: " Bean " in ancient times refers to a vessel for pickling vegetables and meat sauce, and later borrowed as " bean " for bean sprouts.

In ancient times," bean" originally referred to a vessel for pickled vegetables, meat sauce and other foods. The original meaning was a high-ring-footed food vessel, and it was later borrowed as the " bean" of soybean and wheat. "Said Wen": "Beans, ancient meat-eating tools. From the mouth, pictograms. All beans belong to the beans. £Ö£, the ancient words beans." Press " bean" to top a horizontal elephant cover, the middle is like a bean body, and the lower is like a pillar Foot and base. " Beans" appeared in the Shang Dynasty and prevailed in the Spring and Autumn Period and Warring States Period. They are made of pottery, but also made of wood and bronze. Later generations may use " beans" as ritual vessels, "Er Ya. "Shiqi": "Dalok beans are called beans, bamboo beans are called Á¨æ, and tile beans are called Deng." Guo Pu's note: "Beans are also ritual vessels." " Beans" contain pickles and meat sauce , "Zhou Li. Heaven official tomb.ÈÜ¢‰∫∫": "The beans of the dynasty, in fact, leeks, ÈÜìÈÜ¢, Changben, mikyu, jingchu, deer, ÈÜ¢Ëèπ, and mikyu" refer to the beans presented during the rituals of the dynasty. The food is pickles made with leeks, juicy meat sauce, etc. Jiajin inscriptions are used as place names and pronounced " ÈÉñ". "Collection" 24713: "Cai (in) beans." Discrete: "Bean people Yu." Zai Fuyan: "Wang Lai Beast (hunting) from Dou Yi (Lu)" means that the king came to hunt from the foot of Jidi Mountain. "Shuowen": "Xi, Hongnong County Yudi. Congyi, the sound of beans." Another inscription is used as the original meaning, referring to a high-circle-footed food vessel, Zhou Shengdou: "Zhou Shengzha (made) Zundou." Qi Tao is used as a measure word and is an ancient unit of weight, such as "Ancient Pottery Prose Compilation" 3.46: "Haodo." "Zuo Zhuan. "Three Years of Zhao": "Four ascended to beans." In the handed down literature, " bean" is also used as the " bean" of soybean and wheat. "Guang Ya": "Soybeans, Tang Ye; Xiaodou, Ning Ye." "Zhan Guo Ce. "Han Ceyi": "Korean land is dangerous, mountain dwellings, and grains, not wheat but beans", which means that the Korean geography during the Warring States period was bad, the people lived in the mountains, and the grain produced was either wheat or beans (Wang Yinzhi" Jing Chuan Ci": "And, you are also."). Later, the word " dou" was differentiated for the pseudonymous meaning of " dou" in soy wheat. However, " dou" is still commonly used to mean the " dou" of soybean and wheat after the word " dou" appeared.

beans
Basic explanation of words
beans
d√≤u
A family of dicotyledonous plants, both woody and herbaceous plants, such as "red sandalwood", "locust tree", "soybean", "mung bean", "red bean", "pea", "ground peanut", etc., collectively referred to as beans daily Plants also refer to the seeds of these plants: legumes. beans. Pods (corn beans). Soy milk. Bean green. Boil beans to burn dichotoma. shortsighted.
Something shaped like peas: potatoes.
An ancient vessel for holding meat or other foods was shaped like a stilt: glutinous rice.
name.
beans

beans

beans

beans
Name meaning
: Something that looks like a bean; an ancient vessel for holding meat or other food.
